title: Last Frame Isn't Rendered
body:
## Environment Information

|Module|Version|
|-|-|
|`video2x`|video2x-2.7.1-win32-full.zip|
|`ffmpeg`|ffmpeg-20190330-5282cba-win64-static|
|`waifu2x-caffe`|ver 1.2.0.2|
|`waifu2x-converter-cpp`|Whatever was included in the zip|

## Symptom

It appears that Video2X is not including the last frame of the video in the final export for some reason.  I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong, or where exactly the problem lies.  Let me know what you think.  Here's what I mean:

`Upscaling Progress:  99%|####################################################################################################################################################7 | 120/121 [11:17<00:05,  5.68s/it]`

In Premiere, we can see that a frame of the output is missing:
![Adobe Premiere Pro_2019-07-01_22-35-50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36255053/60481088-935adb80-9c51-11e9-83a0-32a4690c28ae.png)

Why isn't the last frame appearing in the output file?  Is this a setting that can be changed somewhere?  I'm not sure what's going wrong.  The full output is included below, for reference:

```
PS E:\upscalingTesting\video2x> ./video2x -i testinput4.mp4 -o out4_8bit.mp4 -m cudnn -r 2
```
